subject: Re: [junit] Junit installation Problems, Help!
msgSnippet: ... 1. Do you know in general how the Java classpath works? If not, then please look for a tutorial. 2. Add the folder C: junit3.8.1 to your CLASSPATH. -- J.
messageBody:
narutolegend wrote:
>
>
> Hi JUnit users,
>
> Im new using junit. unfortunately i already have problems with the
> installation. i followed the readme file that is included with junit
> but i proberly did something wrong. this is what i did:
>
> 1 uzip junit3.8.1
> 2 place the unzipped folder to C:
> 3 the i add in CLASSPATH the following --> C:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
> 4 i run command prompt and go to C:\junit3.8.1
> 5 i type the following java junit.awtui.TestRunner
> junit.samples.AllTests
> 6 the testrunner show up but it said "class not found
> junit.samples.AllTests"
>
> i really dont know how to fix this. i hope you guys can help me out
> because im really interested in Junit.

1. Do you know in general how the Java classpath works? If not, then
please look for a tutorial.

2. Add the folder C:\junit3.8.1 to your CLASSPATH.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
